title: FONT FOR OLD MUNICIPAL SAN FRANCISCO RAILWAY LOGO
content:
Hi,

Can anyone identify the font (or recommend something similar if its hand drawn) in this logo for the San Francisco Municipal Railway?

Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo-1010_4925.png)
author: bfingeroth

comments.content:
It most certainly is hand drawn.  
If an existing typeface was the model, someone could come up with a match.  
In the meantime, looking for “railway” at MyFonts, brings some interesting results.  
Perhaps unsurprisingly, Western Railway ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/western-railway/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/western-railway/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/western-railway/")) has a similar flavour to the words (it needs some condensing for “Municipal”), while something from Greater Albion Typefounders ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/birmingham-new-street/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/birmingham-new-street/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/birmingham-new-street/") [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/great-bromwich/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/great-bromwich/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/great-bromwich/")) could give you the |F|.

Lettering circa 1900.  
The winged \_M\_, heavy letters and big serifs have some similarity to Heirloom Artcraft Black

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HeirloomArtcraftBlackAsMunicip_3950.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/heirloom-artcraft/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/heirloom-artcraft/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/baselinefonts/heirloom-artcraft/")  
compare to a slick lighter version of Artcraft 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ArtcraftAsMunicip_6126.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/artcraft-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/artcraft-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ascender/artcraft-pro/")  
Don

Typo corrected:  
Post Old Style has some similarity -- note in particular the \_R\_ -- and there is a digital version by Jeff Levine as Lamp Post JNL

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LampPostJNLAsMunicip_6349.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/lamp-post/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/lamp-post/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/lamp-post/") but the letters are too wide.  
Don

Some of the serifs, and especially the |A|s have a Latin shape ( [http://www.myfonts.com/search/latin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416125149/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/latin/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/latin/")), which, I think, make them optically better suited to be placed on an arc.
Thank you all very much for the suggestions.
